Trioptolemea species are native to various regions of Africa, particularly in southern and eastern parts of the continent. They often grow in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
